Article/0-0-0-18/proxy.html:
Proxies are the basic mechanism that allow Nullstack to implement rendering and context<\/p>

Understanding the proxy<\/a><\/h2>

Nullstack has some conventions over when to proxy an object<\/p>

Any mutations to a proxy will trigger a rerender cycle<\/p>

Instances of Nullstack class are always proxied<\/p> 

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  // standard javascript objects are proxied<\/span>
  standardObjects =<\/span> {<\/span> key<\/span>:<\/span> 'value'<\/span> }<\/span>

  // nested standard javascript objects are proxied<\/span>
  nestedObjects =<\/span> {<\/span>nested<\/span>:<\/span> {<\/span> key<\/span>:<\/span> 'value'<\/span> }<\/span>}<\/span>

  // standard arrays are proxied<\/span>
  standardArray =<\/span> [<\/span>1<\/span>,<\/span> 2<\/span>,<\/span> 3<\/span>]<\/span>

  // nested standard arrays are proxied<\/span>
  nestedArray =<\/span> [<\/span>[<\/span>1<\/span>,<\/span> 2<\/span>,<\/span> 3<\/span>]<\/span>]<\/span>

  // custom classes are not proxied<\/span>
  customClassInstance =<\/span> new<\/span> CustomClass<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span>

  // uderscored properties are never proxied<\/span>
  _underscoredArray =<\/span> [<\/span>]<\/span>
  _underscoredObject =<\/span> {<\/span>}<\/span>

  // dom references are not proxied<\/span>
  element =<\/span> null<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    <<\/span>div<\/span> ref<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>element}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span> element </<\/span>div<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Understanding the functions scope<\/a><\/h2>
Nullstack has some conventions over when to expose the context to a function<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Component<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> staticAsyncFunction<\/span>(<\/span>serverContext<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // static and async functions have access to the server context<\/span>
    // an instance method reflection of this function is created<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the Component class<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  static<\/span> async<\/span> _underscoredStaticAsyncFunction<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // static and async and underscored functions have no access to context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the Component class<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  static<\/span> staticFunction<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // static only functions have no access to context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the Component class<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  static<\/span> _underscoredStaticFunction<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // static only and underscored functions have no access to context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the Component class<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  method<\/span>(<\/span>clientContext<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // methods have access to the client context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the instance<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  _underscoredMethod<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // underscored methods have no access to the client context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the instance<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> asyncMethod<\/span>(<\/span>clientContext<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // async methods have access to the client context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the instance<\/span>
  }<\/span>
   
  async<\/span> _underscoredAsyncMethod<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // underscored async methods have no access to the client context<\/span>
    // this will be bound to the instance<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Component;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

Underscored tricks<\/a><\/h2>
You can create a method starting with _<\/code>, that means you're creating vanilla JS code that ignores proxies.<\/p>

With that you'll be able to add or remove the event listener.<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> "Nullstack"<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
  _listener<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // do something<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    window.<\/span>addEventListener<\/span>(<\/span>"resize"<\/span>,<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>_listener,<\/span> false<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> terminate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    window.<\/span>removeEventListener<\/span>(<\/span>"resize"<\/span>,<\/span> this<\/span>.<\/span>_listener,<\/span> false<\/span>)<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>Content</<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>
}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

You can also use it to ignore the context<\/p>

import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> "Nullstack"<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>
  _method<\/span>(<\/span>prop<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // do something<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  async<\/span> hydrate<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    // notice its not passing an object as context normally requires<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>_method<\/span>(<\/span>true<\/span>)<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>
